definition: the multitude of common people (in highbrow literature)/plebeian
numerous/common people (or populace)/born of a concubine

sentences.english: It has to do most vividly with the very question, "Which language should the subaltern speak in?"
sentences.chinese: 它和下述問題有密切聯繫，“庶民以哪種語言講話？

sentences.english: He did not trust the common people.
We are obliged to go fair , and softly , and in Practice you know We are the subjects.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須公正溫和，實際上你知道我們都是庶民。

sentences.english: The king muse be subject to the law.
Qaddafi’s power has for a long time relied on the docility of ordinary Libyans.
sentences.chinese: 長期以來，聽話的庶民一直是卡扎菲政權的根基。

sentences.english: Chapter 4 surveys Wuhe's concern over the common people culture and his original country complex.
sentences.chinese: 第四章探訪舞鶴對臺灣庶民文化的關懷及其原鄉情結。

sentences.english: The people knew he did not like them.
sentences.chinese: 庶民知道他不喜歡他們。

definition: high-ranking officials in the court of a Chinese emperor
imperial clan/member of the imperial clan/clansman/ancestral shrine
social stratum below the level of ordinary people/untouchable/dalit (India caste)
land-owning class, esp. during Wei, Jin and North-South dynasties 魏晉南北朝|魏晋南北朝
the (rightful) emperor/"Son of Heaven" (traditional English translation)
